info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:21PM EDT until June 14 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BERKS...NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTH CENTRAL CHESTER COUNTIES... At 220 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Birdsboro, or 10 miles southeast of Reading, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Birdsboro, Elverson, New Morgan, Pughtown, Cedarville, Gilbertsville, Stowe, Pottsgrove, South Pottstown, Amity Gardens, Kenilworth, Flying Hills, Halfway House, Lorane and Sanatoga. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 302. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 9. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
